content: the back loops pattern notes gauge is not important here as with many shawls though a heavier gauge yarn will produce a larger warmer shawl and will also use more yarn than the sample you can make this shawl larger by repeating the dropped stitch ​ and eyelet sections until you reach the size you want before binding off it is ​ worth noting that in testing increasing the size of the shawl by one full pattern repeat eyelets and dropped stitches used approximately 40% more yarn it is always a good idea to swatch with your chosen yarn and needles before you begin i used every last inch of my skein to knit the sample shawl so ​ remember to keep your swatch - you can unravel it to add to your shawl if needed video tutorials are available for the following stitches kyok https //youtu be/q6ontcllbh4 dropped stitches https //youtu be/letxs61dpkm stretchy bind off https //youtu be/tc0aizbyw9e ​ garter tab https //youtu be/0n3dq6gbwk4 4 bear lights shawl by snowy thistle knits pattern stitches dropped stitches this two row technique uses extra wraps when working the stitch dropping them on the next row and creating elongated stitches this is a good introduction to lace for beginner knitters and creates an interesting airy fabric row 1 step 1 insert your needle into the next stitch as if to knit ​ step 2 wrap your yarn three times around your right needle before pulling ​ it through to complete the stitch as usual for each stitch you will now have three loops on your right needle instead of one step 3 repeat step 2 to the end of the row or as instructed ​ row 2 step 1 when you reach the first three-looped stitch insert your right ​ needle into the first loop knit this as usual and drop the other two loops from the left needle step 2 pull gently and allow the new stitch to elongate ​ step 3 repeat step 2 to the end of the row or as instructed ​ stretchy bind-off this is a very good technique for the cast-off edge of a shawl ribbing or anywhere you might need an extra little bit of stretch step 1 work the first two stitches you will have two stitches on your right ​ needle step 2 insert your left needle into the front of these two stitches wrap the ​ yarn over your right needle and pull it through you have knitted these two stitches together through the back loops k2tog tbl you have one stitch on your right needle step 3 work the next stitch on your left needle you will have two stitches ​ on your right needle again step 4 repeat steps 2 and 3 until all stitches are bound off ​ 5 bear lights shawl by snowy thistle knits pattern garter tab cast on cast on 3 stitches and knit 9 row turn work through 90 degrees and pick up 4 stitches
